creator: colin@bitterfield.com
text:
The following parameters are the most frequently changed and should be command
line configuration options.

user to run as: (Like in Apache 1.3.x)
group to run as: " "

DEFAULT_SERVER_LIMIT (At least a choice from 1024, 2048, and 4096)
This would be easier than CFLAGS="-DDEFAULT_SERVER_LIMIT" and less esoteric for
the  less sophistacated user.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
You can do all that by defining DEFAULT_USER, DEFAULT_GROUP already in
CFLAGS/CPPFLAGS, if you know what you're doing (unless there's some reason that
doesn't work).  Adding configure switches for all the various macro definitions
seems redundant.
